Yes, you can remove the `og:image:width` and `og:image:height` meta tags, since the size of the image is already specified in the `og:image` tag. And, adding the `twitter:card` and `twitter:image` meta tags to your HTML will ensure that Twitter displays the link preview image correctly. Here's the complete example:
```php
<meta property="og:image" content="https://www.example.com/image.jpg" />
<meta name="twitter:card" content="summary_large_image">
<meta name="twitter:image" content="https://www.example.com/image.jpg">
```
Make sure to replace the URL in the `content` attribute with the URL of your image.
